results.title: He Taught Americans to Cook Indian Food. Now He’s on His Final Chapter.
results.abstract: Raghavan Iyer, whose books and spirited teaching spread the cuisine, is using his last days to get familiar comfort foods to patients like himself.

media.caption: As the end of his life nears, Raghavan Iyer is publishing a new book and promoting the importance of feeding patients foods that speak to their origins and conditions.

results.title: Alligator Kills 85-Year-Old Florida Woman as She Walks Her Dog
results.abstract: Serious injuries caused by alligators are rare in Florida, state wildlife officials said, although this was at least the third fatal encounter in the past year.

media.caption: Law enforcement officers and Florida Fish and Wildlife investigators responded to the deadly alligator attack in Fort Pierce, Fla., on Monday.

results.title: Oldest Nearly Complete Hebrew Bible Heads to Auction
results.abstract: The Codex Sassoon, believed to date from the late ninth or early 10th century, is set to be sold by Sotheby’s for an estimated $30 million to $50 million.

media.caption: The Codex Sassoon, headed for auction in May, is considered the oldest nearly complete Hebrew Bible.
media.copyright: Eric Helgas for The New York Times

results.abstract: Is it OK for an athlete — or anyone, really — to have an extraordinary gift and not use it? The golfer Anthony Kim apparently decided, emphatically, that it is.

results.title: Jessica Chastain Returns to the Stage With Nothing to Prove
results.abstract: In a pared-down Broadway revival of “A Doll’s House,” the Oscar-winning actress doesn’t have props, period costumes or much of a set. To her surprise, she likes it.

media.caption: “In the beginning, when I got all that attention so quickly,” Jessica Chastain said, “it just felt like this isn’t going to last. I felt so scared. It felt so unearned.”
